definition: see 一著不慎，滿盤皆輸|一着不慎，满盘皆输[yi1 zhao1 bu4 shen4 , man3 pan2 jie1 shu1]
Manchu ethnic group
to fill/full/filled/packed/fully/completely/quite/to reach the limit/to satisfy/satisfied/contented

plate/dish/tray/board/hard drive (computing)/to build/to coil/to check/to examine/to transfer (property)/to make over/classifier for food: dish, helping/to coil/classifier for coils of wire/classifier for games of chess
all/each and every/in all cases
to lose/to transport/to donate/to enter (a password)
One careless move and the whole game is lost. (idiom)
pinyin: yi1 zhao1 bu4 shen4 , man3 pan2 jie1 shu1

sentences.english: Thus, even if some of the investment losses, not worth.
sentences.chinese: 这样，即使一些投资受了损失，也不致于满盘皆输。

sentences.english: Good returns are high, it may worth worse.
sentences.chinese: 好则回报高，差则可能满盘皆输。

sentences.english: To his rue, the error cost him the game.
sentences.chinese: 让他后悔的是，这个错误让他满盘皆输。

sentences.english: One step wrong will be the loser of the situation, I did not take the power.
sentences.chinese: 一步错就将是满盘皆输的局面，我没有承担的力量。

sentences.english: A right move now is the premise of"whole loss" in the future.
sentences.chinese: 现在正确的一着，是以后满盘皆输的前提。

definition: One careless move and the whole game is lost. (idiom)
pinyin: yi1 zhao1 bu4 shen4 , man3 pan2 jie1 shu1

definition: consigned to eternal damnation/with no hope of reprieve
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
the slightest difference leads to a huge error (idiom)/a miss is as good as a mile
pinyin: cha1 zhi1 hao2 li2 , miu4 yi3 qian1 li3

definition: to waste all one's previous efforts (idiom)/all that has been achieved goes down the drain
to lose everything one invested (idiom)/to lose one's shirt
to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
a tiny lapse can lead to a huge mistake (idiom); a minor discrepancy leading to enormous losses
pinyin: shi1 zhi1 hao2 li2 , miu4 yi3 qian1 li3

definition: a single slip may cause everlasting sorrow (idiom)
pinyin: yi1 shi1 zu2 cheng2 qian1 gu3 hen4

definition: momentary slip/false step/ill-considered action
blunder (in chess)
a plateful/comprehensive/the full works (e.g. a banquet)/the full price
dead piece (in Chess)/stupid move/hopeless case
to make a serious mistake (idiom)
lit. to ruin the enterprise for the sake of one basketful/to fail through lack of a final effort/to spoil the ship for a ha'penny worth of tar (idiom)
to go the wrong way/to take the wrong (road, exit etc)
